title: High Resolution Celebrations - Animated Edition
body:
Ten days ago, I published my article “High Resolution Celebrations” to share images to use in celebrating milestones on Substack.

[High Resolution Celebrations](https://genejoy.substack.com/p/high-resolution-celebrations)

But then I had an idea: what about animations?

Animated images convey both motion and progress - people who have reached milestones took a while to get where they are through hard work. As such, I decided to provide analogous animations for each of the images in my previous post.

When making these animations, I had to decide what number to start with and how many frames to use. The first time I made the animations, I started with a number that was one-tenth of the final value to give a total of 10 frames. However, I decided against that as that would imply that people hitting higher milestones had something of a head start, instead of beginning at the same point as everyone else. Even if some of us did have a head start of sorts, I considered it best to have each animation start with zero and use 11 frames for each animation.

Let’s celebrate progress together!
